footer.description: Learn all about European countries, capitals, and geography

home.title: Learn European Countries
home.subtitle: Discover the countries of Europe, their capitals, flags, and geographical locations through interactive learning tools and quizzes.

map.title: Interactive Map
map.description: Explore the countries of Europe on an interactive map. Click on any country to learn more about it.

info.title: Comprehensive Information
info.description: Access detailed information about each European country, including its capital, region, neighbors, and interesting facts.

quiz.title: Knowledge Quizzes
quiz.description: Test your knowledge with interactive quizzes on European countries, their capitals, flags, and geographic locations.

countries.title: European Countries
countries.tryAdjusting: Try adjusting your search criteria or filters

map.title: Interactive European Map
map.subtitle: Explore the countries of Europe on the interactive map. Click on any country to view more information, or use the zoom controls to navigate.
map.tip: You can zoom in/out using the controls or your mouse wheel, and pan the map by dragging it.

quiz.title: European Countries Quiz

capitals.name: Capitals
capitals.description: Test your knowledge of the capital cities of European countries.

flags.name: Flags
flags.description: Identify European countries by their flags.

regions.name: Regions
regions.description: Match European countries to their geographic regions.

facts.name: Facts
facts.description: Test your knowledge of interesting facts about European countries.

quiz.questions: The quiz contains 10 questions. Good luck!
quiz.feedbackExcellent: Excellent! You are a European geography expert!
quiz.feedbackGreat: Great job! You know Europe very well!
quiz.feedbackGood: Good effort! You have a solid understanding of European geography.
quiz.feedbackNeedsWork: Keep learning! Europe has so many interesting countries to discover.
quiz.flagQuestion: Which country does this flag {{flag}} belong to?
quiz.stopwatchInfo: Take the quiz at your own pace. A stopwatch will track your total time, and your final results will show how long it took you to complete the quiz.

notFound.subtitle: Page Not Found
notFound.message: The page you are looking for might have been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.

albania_description: Albania is a country in Southeast Europe on the Adriatic and Ionian Sea. It shares land borders with Montenegro, Kosovo, North Macedonia, and Greece.
albania_fact1: Albania has over 750,000 bunkers scattered throughout the country.
albania_fact2: The majority of Albanians are Muslim, making it one of the few European countries with a Muslim majority.
albania_fact3: The Albanian language, known as Shqip, is one of the oldest in Europe.
andorra_description: Andorra is a small, landlocked country located between France and Spain in the Pyrenees mountains.
andorra_fact1: Andorra has no airport or train stations, making it accessible only by road.
andorra_fact2: It is the only country in the world with Catalan as its official language.
andorra_fact3: Andorra has the highest life expectancy in the world at around 83 years.
austria_description: Austria is a landlocked country in Central Europe with a high standard of living. It borders Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Slovenia, Italy, Switzerland, and Liechtenstein.
austria_fact1: Vienna, the capital of Austria, has been ranked as the most liveable city in the world multiple times.
austria_fact2: The Austrian flag is one of the oldest national flags in the world.
austria_fact3: The famous composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was born in Salzburg, Austria.
poland_description: Poland is a country in Central Europe bordered by Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, Lithuania, and the Baltic Sea.
poland_fact1: Poland is the 9th largest country in Europe.
poland_fact2: Marie Curie, the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, was born in Poland.
poland_fact3: Poland has 16 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
